summary: Why I always will defend Sansa Stark Name the 3 most evil characters in GOT: Ramsay Bolton, Joffrey Lannister and Night King....
body:
Why I always will defend Sansa Stark

Name the 3 most evil characters in GOT: Ramsay Bolton, Joffrey Lannister and Night King. Sansa survived two of them. She killed one of them and was unknowingly involved in killing the other one (though Littlefinger did kill him for her)

Name the 3 cleverest players of the game: Cersei Lannister, Petyr Baelish and Varys. Two of them were instrumental in teaching her about the game. She escaped one of them and killed the other with Arya and Bran.

summary: Honestly, it’s been a huge part of our lives and the only part we can remember (laughs) but it’s definitely like, you can feel a...
text:
Honestly, it’s been a huge part of our lives and the only part we can remember (laughs) but it’s definitely like, you can feel a chapter ending and a new one beginning,” Maisie pondered. “It’s necessary but really sad.”


Sophie chimed in: “It’s very bittersweet; it’s like we’re mourning death. It’s very interesting (pauses) it’s like the death of all characters, but not that our characters are dying (laughs), it’s the fact that we’re leaving these characters behind whenever we get to be them again. Yeah, it’s terrifying.

summary: We all know that even Sansa and Daenerys should be given a sword or something to fight in the war againts the white walkers...
question: We all know that even Sansa and Daenerys should be given a sword or something to fight in the war againts the white walkers because Jon or Sansa I don't remember well who said that every men, women or child that could fight needed to do it. So we put aside the teaser because it's just a teaser but in the show they need ti fight with some weapons
answer: It was Jon who said that every man, woman and child above a certain age will be trained in fighting. When he stated that, he was actively excluding the people who would have a different function in the war to come. There needs to be someone who is out there managing the population and keeping the morale up. There needs to be someone who is handling the munition and rations. Sansa will fill these roles that not everyone can fill. Her training and the tutelage she had have prepared her to do these things. There’s absolutely no reason for her to waste these in order to be just another body fighting against the white walkers. Not to forget that when training began, she had way too many responsibilities and things to do than waste her time trying to learn to fight. She had an entire kingdom to govern and prepare for the war that was coming. She had a ridiculous amount of paperwork to do,  she had meetings that she had to set up, she had to do check ups, she had to handle the rations and the munitions and she also had Winterfell that she had to take care of as well. She filled a role that most couldnt fill, and she will continue to fill it in the coming season rather than waste her time on trying to learn to fight. Also, when it comes to Daenerys, your point is also ridiculous. There were so many other things that were much more important than learning how to fight that she had to deal with since coming to Westeros, and now, if she is to appear on the battlefield, all she needs to do is be on her dragon and deal with the wights from there. Anyways, the idea that a person can only contribute in a war by fighting is completely ridiculous, seeing as Sansa herself has been incredibly important in the preparation for the war and she did that without grabbing a sword, and guess what? She’ll continue to contribute without even thinking about swinging a sword. So no they don’t need to fight with some weapons, as they both have much more important roles in the coming war that only they can fill.

summary: The funny thing to me is when they repeatedly called Sansa stupid and other derogatory remarks. Then, cited "I'm loyal to my...
question: The funny thing to me is when they repeatedly called Sansa stupid and other derogatory remarks. Then, cited "I'm loyal to my beloved Joffrey" as evidence. That is how low Sansa haters level of intellect and critical thinking skills.

summary: Just b/c Sansa and Arya are sisters doesn't mean they have to be close. Not all siblings are close. I understand wanting them to...
question: Just b/c Sansa and Arya are sisters doesn't mean they have to be close. Not all siblings are close. I understand wanting them to be cordial or friendly but this weird thing, in my opinion, of wanting them to be bffs is ridiculous. They don't need to be close to have a good relationship.
answer: Exactly!!!! I’m sick of seeing Stark sisters this and Stark sisters that. Arya was pouty about Sansa being Lady of Winterfell before the Lords tried to crown Sansa as queen. Like what kind of stans are we that we think someone like that will help Sansa in any substantial way? We all know she’s going to say something misogynistic to Sansa at least once per episode. I know Maisie and Sophie love working together but I’m praying D&D’s hatred of women interacting rears its head again. I don’t want unearned scenes where they ‘support’ each other (aka where Sansa is nice and appreciative and Arya isn’t, like the battlement scene). I am perfectly happy with them being acquaintances at best.

summary: I'd love to believe that the spoiler scroll Sophie kept from season 8 is a scroll from Jon telling her the truth of his...
body:
I’d love to believe that the spoiler scroll Sophie kept from season 8 is a scroll from Jon telling her the truth of his intentions with Daenerys. Whether he gave it to her before he left or somehow sent it to her while in Dragonstone… It would be a note telling her to believe in him and that the North remembers. He remembers.

Or my other thought is it’s a call back to when Sansa wrote a note to Robb. Only this time it’s to Jon and he actually comes for her. I’ve seen other people talking about this possibility and considering how much game of thrones loves to do call backs to the earlier seasons I wouldn’t be surprised if this is the one that ends up happening!

Either one pleases my little shipper heart haha.
